text: Vladimír Miko (22 March 1943 - 30 December 2017), was a male former international table tennis player from Slovakia. ==Table tennis career== He won a bronze medal at the 1967 World Table Tennis Championships with Jaroslav Staněk. He started playing in 1951 and was coached by Ladislav Štípek and Ludvík Vyhnanovský. He played in five European Championships, reached a world ranking of 9 and retired in 1970. He also won five English Open titles. ==Coaching== He was the national coach of Luxembourg from 1971-1973, and then the national coach for Czechoslovakia until 1990. ==See also== * List of table tennis players * List of World Table Tennis Championships medalists ==References== Category:Slovak male table tennis players Category:1943 births Category:2017 deaths Category:World Table Tennis Championships medalists Category:Czechoslovak table tennis players Category:People from Krupina
title: Vladimír Miko
